metadata.title: CVE-2017-12982 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - low
metadata.description:
The bmp_read_info_header function in bin/jp2/convertbmp.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0does not reject headers with a zero biBitCount, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (memory allocation failure) in theopj_image_create function in lib/openjp2/image.c, related to theopj_aligned_alloc_n function in opj_malloc.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-1').
